vulnerabilities.name: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: The application does not properly validate user inputs, leading to potential vulnerabilities such as SQL Injection and XSS.
vulnerabilities.impact: Unauthorized access, data breaches, or application compromise.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Validate and sanitize user inputs, enforce strict input length and type constraints.

vulnerabilities.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.description: Malicious scripts are injected into trusted websites, executed in the victimâ€™s browser.
vulnerabilities.impact: Data theft, session hijacking, malware installation.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Escape and sanitize user inputs, implement a Content Security Policy (CSP).

vulnerabilities.name: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Unsanitized inputs are used in database queries, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands.
vulnerabilities.impact: Unauthorized data access, database modification or destruction.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements, validate inputs.

vulnerabilities.name: OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Allows attackers to execute unauthorized operating system commands.
vulnerabilities.impact: System compromise, data theft, or disruption of services.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Validate inputs and avoid directly passing user inputs to system commands.

vulnerabilities.name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
vulnerabilities.description: Accepting and processing untrusted serialized data, which could lead to code execution.
vulnerabilities.impact: Code execution, data tampering, privilege escalation.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Use secure serialization libraries, validate serialized input.

vulnerabilities.name: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.description: Data is written outside the allocated memory buffer, overwriting adjacent memory.
vulnerabilities.impact: System crashes, data corruption, or remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Use secure coding practices, apply bounds checking, and avoid unsafe functions.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Authorization
vulnerabilities.description: Critical functions can be accessed without proper permissions or authentication.
vulnerabilities.impact: Unauthorized actions, sensitive data exposure, privilege escalation.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Enforce proper authentication and authorization mechanisms for critical functions.

vulnerabilities.name: Insecure Cryptographic Storage
vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive information is stored insecurely without encryption or weak encryption.
vulnerabilities.impact: Exposure of sensitive data like passwords, credit card numbers.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Use strong encryption algorithms, securely manage encryption keys.

vulnerabilities.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: Attackers force a server to make unintended HTTP requests, often targeting internal services.
vulnerabilities.impact: Access to sensitive internal data, system compromise.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Validate and sanitize user-controlled URLs, restrict network access with firewalls.

vulnerabilities.name: Windows TCP/IP IPv6 RCE Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: A vulnerability in the Windows TCP/IP stack allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by sending specially crafted IPv6 packets.
vulnerabilities.impact: Full system compromise on Windows systems with IPv6 enabled.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Disable IPv6 if not required, apply the latest Windows security patches, monitor unusual traffic.
vulnerabilities.vulnerable_versions: All Windows versions with IPv6 enabled prior to November 2024 patches.
vulnerabilities.fixed_versions: Windows versions updated with November 2024 patches.

vulnerabilities.name: CUPS Remote Code Execution
vulnerabilities.description: A vulnerability in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) enables attackers to execute malicious code by replacing IPP URLs during print jobs.
vulnerabilities.impact: Complete system compromise, data theft, or production system damage.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Apply patches from CUPS developers or disable printing services if unnecessary.

vulnerabilities.name: OpenSSH Race Condition RCE
vulnerabilities.description: A race condition in OpenSSH's sshd daemon allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code and gain root access.
vulnerabilities.impact: System compromise, malware installation, network propagation.
vulnerabilities.prevention: Update OpenSSH to the latest version, restrict SSH access, monitor logs for anomalies.
